meanings.definition: The action of surrounding or attacking someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The besetment of the castle by enemy forces was fierce.
meanings.sent2: The hikers faced besetment from all sides by wild animals.
meanings.sent3: The besetment of the picnic by ants turned it into a comedy of errors.
meanings.sent4: The besetment of doubts in his mind was like a dark cloud looming over him.
meanings.sent5: The besetment of the maze with traps made it nearly impossible to escape.

meanings.definition: A situation or condition that causes difficulty or trouble.
meanings.sent1: The financial besetment led to many sleepless nights.
meanings.sent2: The besetment of constant rain made the journey challenging.
meanings.sent3: The besetment of forgetting his keys every day became a running joke.
meanings.sent4: The besetment of fear paralyzed him from taking any action.
meanings.sent5: The besetment of the broken elevator caused chaos in the building.
